noun.description: Any of various small annelid worms belonging to the class Myzostomida, which have disc-like bodies with suckers and are commensals and ectoparasites of echinoderms, especially crinoids.

adjective.description: Of, relating to, or designating a myzostomid.

origin: Early 20th century; earliest use found in Encyclopaedia Britannica. From scientific Latin Myzostomida, class name from Myzostoma + -ida.
